intro: Phaseolus vulgaris convar. elongatus, commonly known as the runner bean, is a variant of the common bean characterized by its elongated, trailing growth habit. It produces pods that are typically longer and narrower than those of standard beans, often reaching lengths of 15–30 cm. The plant is an annual legume native to the Americas, thriving in temperate climates. Its flowers are usually white or pale pink, and the pods contain seeds that are rich in protein and nutrients. This variety is widely cultivated for both fresh consumption and drying, contributing to its popularity in gardens and agriculture.
